org.mundo.rt
Class Mundo

java.lang.Object
  org.mundo.rt.Mundo

public class Mundo
extends java.lang.Object

The Mundo class provides some basic functions, that every application requires. It has static methods and cannot be instantiated.

By default, MundoCore reads the configuration file node.conf.xml at startup.

Author:
Erwin Aitenbichler, Andreas Hartl

Mundo

Method Detail

registerService

public static boolean registerService(Service service)
Registers a new service. This involves the following actions:
  • The service is assigned a unique identifier.
  • The service is assigned a Session. Sessions allow services to publish and consume messages.
  • Finally, the init method of the service is called to initialize publisher and subscriber objects, etc.

Parameters:
service - the service to register.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the node is currently shutting down.

registerMovedService

public static void registerMovedService(Service service)
Registers a migrated service at the new location.

unregisterService

public static boolean unregisterService(Service service)
Unregisters the specified service by calling its shutdown method and removing it from the list of active services. Runtime exceptions thrown by the service are masked.

Parameters:
service - the service to unregister.
Returns:
true if the service's shutdown method succeeds; false otherwise.
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the node is currently shutting down.
java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if the service is not registered.

unregisterMovedService

public static void unregisterMovedService(Service service)
Unregisters a service at the current location before migration.

getNodeId

public static GUID getNodeId()
Returns the GUID identifying this node. Typically, there is a one-to-one relationship between nodes and Java VMs running.

Returns:
the GUID of this node.

getNodeName

public static java.lang.String getNodeName()
Returns the friendly name of the node.

setNodeName

public static void setNodeName(java.lang.String name)
Sets the friendly name of the node.

getServices

public static java.util.Vector<Service> getServices()
Returns a list of the registered services.

Returns:
the registered services.

getServiceByType

public static Service getServiceByType(java.lang.Class c)
Finds a service by type. Searches in the list of registered services for a service that matches the specified class.

Parameters:
c - class of service to find.
Returns:
the service found, and null if no matching service is available.

getServiceByType

public static Service getServiceByType(java.lang.String className)
Finds a service by type. Searches in the list of registered services for a service that matches the specified class.

Parameters:
className - class name of service to find.
Returns:
the service found, or null if no matching service is available; or null if the specified class name does not exist.

setRootService

public static void setRootService(RootService service)
Sets the root service. This method must be called before Mundo.init. The root service is the first service created during initialization and it is the parent of all other services. It will receive notifications when other services are registered or unregistered. If no root service is explicitly specified, Mundo.init will automatically create a org.mundo.service.ServiceManager that will create services as specified in the node configuration file.

init

public static void init()
Initializes this MundoCore node. This method must be called from the user application prior to using any publisher and subscriber objects, etc.

shutdown

public static void shutdown()

Shuts down the current node. shutdown terminates all registered services by calling their shutdown methods in the reverse order they were registered. After that, shutdown waits until all threads in the mundocore thread group have terminated.

This method should be called from the user application before the application exits. Not calling shutdown before program termination has consequences like:

  • Neighbor nodes do not receive the information that we have shut down. They might try (several times) to reconnect to this node. This causes unnecessary network traffic.
  • Log files will be truncated, because the log file is not closed.

getThreadGroup

public static java.lang.ThreadGroup getThreadGroup()
Returns the mundocore thread group. If services create additional threads, these threads should be created in the mundocore thread group. When the node is shutting down, the shutdown method will wait until all threads in this group have terminated.

Returns:
the mundocore thread group.

getState

public static int getState()
Returns the current state.

Returns:
the current state, which is one of STATE_*.

distributedIdentity

public static boolean distributedIdentity(java.lang.Object a,
                                          java.lang.Object b)
Compares two objects for identity, regardless whether they are local or distributed objects. Two distribued objects are considered identical if they are equal. A local and a distributed object is considered identical if the distributed object's local object is identical to the other one. Two local objects are considered identical if the == operator returns true. The following holds true: 
   X a = new X(), b = new X();
   DoX doA = new DoX(a), doA1 = new DoX(a1), doB = new DoX(b);
   
   distributedIdentity(null, null) == (null == null) == true
   distributedIdentity(a, null) == (a == null) == false
   distributedIdentity(a, a) == (a == a) == true
   distributedIdentity(a, b) == (a == b) == false
   distributedIdentity(doA, doA) == doA.equals(doA) == true
   distributedIdentity(doA, doA1) == doA.equals(doA1) == true
   distributedIdentity(doA, doB) == doA.equals(doB) == false
   distributedIdentity(a, doA) == (a == doA._getDistributedObject()) == true

Parameters:
a - The first object to compare
b - The second object to compare
Returns:
true if both objects are either the same or would be the same if one wouldn't be a distributed object

getConfig

public static TypedMap getConfig()
Returns the node configuration. User services can also make use of the node configuration file to read their settings from.

Returns:
the node configuration as map.

setConfig

public static void setConfig(TypedMap in)
Sets the node configuration. The field config-type of the specified map defines how the current configuration and the new configuration are merged. If config-type=="full" (default), then the specified map replaces the configuration. If config-type=="overlay", then the existing configuration is extended and duplicate fields are overridden.

setConfigFile

public static void setConfigFile(java.lang.String filename)
Sets the name of the configuration file. The configuration file is read during init(). The default configuration file name is "node.conf.xml". This method can be used to read the configuration from an alternate file. setConfigFile must be called prior to init().

Parameters:
filename - The file name of the configuration file to use.

setConfigXML

public static void setConfigXML(java.lang.String xmlText)
Sets the configuration. As an alternative to using configuration files, the content of the configuration file can be passed to this method. setConfigXML must be called before init(). If this method is used, init() will not try to read the configuration from a file.

setConfigXML

public static void setConfigXML(java.io.Reader rd)
Sets the configuration. The XML configuration file will be read from the specified reader. setConfig must be called before init(). If this method is used, init() will not try to read the configuration from a file.

getVersion

public static java.lang.String getVersion()

main

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
